weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the day unfolds under a cloak of mostly clear blue skies, albeit with a lingering veil of clouds that hint at the coastal fog typical of this locale. As the sun climbs higher, the temperature dances around a comfortable 70 degrees, gradually easing down to the mid-60s as afternoon approaches, while a brisk west-southwest wind adds a refreshing chill, especially in the evening. The gusts, reaching up to 30 mph, lend a lively buoyancy to the atmosphere, invigorating both the city and those who wander its streets.

As you step outside, consider layering lightly—a breathable long-sleeve shirt topped with a lightweight jacket will suffice against the cool breezes, particularly near the water where the marine layer may linger. For those who seek simple pleasures this idyllic day offers, a leisurely stroll along the waterfront or a quiet moment sipping coffee in one of the many cafés can be restorative. Alternatively, the bustling energy of the local shops beckons, providing perfect opportunities to explore or simply admire the city’s architectural charm amidst the fading morning clouds.
